name: places/ChIJ5anD1XhZwokR-KvWj_GLYpQ
formattedAddress: 305 East 86th St, New York, NY 10028, USA
adrFormatAddress: 305 East 86th St, New York, NY 10028, USA

originalText.text:
Just moved out like a block away and couldn't be happier, not to mention I pay $6K less for the same size apartment......Yorkshire building is dirty, smelly, apartments AC/heat controlled by management and my kids were freezing where management refused to put the heat on. It was 58 degrees in my toddler's room and they did not want to put the heat on. There are about 15 apartments that moved out recently and doorman told me that people are leaving because apartments are overpriced and you get old appliances, water damaged walls and floors, my tub stopper after multiple visits never worked in the 2 years I was there, washing machine I was told will be checked but never was in the 2 YEARS I WAS THERE, it would sometimes work and sometimes wouldn't, wall paint was falling off all over the apartment and I asked them multiple times (I have emails to prove) to come and check on paint since I have 2 little kids, noone ever did. Owner of the building just doesn't care. Even doorman said so, people who were working there for 40+ years say it's really sad it has come to this. At the end of the day it is management that is just not good, doesn't care and is not willing to work with you. They just care to take your money, but what they give you is urine smelled entrance at ALL TIMES since dogs all pee right when you exit your home and when you enter your home, poorly maintained and dirty all over the place and all they post on Street Easy and Zillow are not current photos, they are all old photos from when the building was new and maintained properly.
I work with many buildings in the area and they all say that Yorkshire Towers is known to have one of the worst managements which is visible in the way building is maintained for sure.... Oh well, now I have heat I control myself, super who comes for every little problem and he comes right away, no mice/dead rats/garbage around the building, and don't give them extra $60K a year for nothing....their loss. I think building owner should look a bit closer on the team that leads his property. He is as good as the team he has which just says one thing....Bad leader all around.

originalText.text:
Not a nice building, they are so overpriced and they are combination of control rentals as well so you have all types of people living in the building. Not to mention how dirty is building at all times, management not helpful and you CANNOT control the heat or AC, so we had 88 degrees in the apartment this June but it was not "the date" they have pencils in so we had days of absolute torture without any AC until the building had arranged date they would change the system. Same was in winter when I had 55 in my room and there was no heater to put up since building didn't swap the system. Right now my fridge is broken, tub has not worked since I moved in after they came to fix it 2-3 times already, sliding doors as well.
Go somewhere where for the price like they ask here you can get so much better.....

originalText.text: Lived here for two years. Always had construction upstairs. Doormen are rude and unhelpful. We saw a small mice and had a cockroach problem. Elevator is always broken and there's always a wait. The pool is very nice. The apartments themselves are well portioned and nice. Overall would think twice before living here

originalText.text: Bad management, dirty building, smelly entrance all full of dog urine and poop, its just horrible. In summer it smells like you walk into worst building in projects....do not rent here, so many people are leaving since they are mislead. Go somewhere where yo will get  all for your buck, this is not a place.
